author: nc1234
content: <@199561711278227457> Is there any plan to add eip7805 to dora? eip7805 blocks are not showing up on Dora because it doesn't recognize eip7805 version in `Eth-Consensus-Version` returned by `getBlock` beacon api. Currently I force Lodestar to return Electra version in order for it to show up on Dora. Not sure how prysm get around this

author: terencechain
content: We may have overloaded fulu for it to showed up or there's a Dora image somewhere I forgot

author: parithosh
content: cc <@845691100072509460> , i think he was looking into ILs and dora?

author: jih2nn
content: Oh I'm on a different tasks at the moment. I was implementing beacon API to Prysm and am planning to move to Dora afterward. It would took quite some time for me to get back to it so if it's urgent please feel free to go for it. I've added go-eth2-client type so it should be straightforward.

author: jih2nn
content: Wait, is it blocks not ILs? Looks like it's related to supporting `eip7805` fork?

author: jungerian
content: Delayed execution and delayed state_root are almost the same?

author: soispoke
content:
Delayed execution is more general (i.e., it delays more than just state root validation: receipts and logs as well)

Links: 
- Delayed execution: https://ethresear.ch/t/delayed-execution-and-skipped-transactions/21677
- Delayed state root: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7862

author: pk910
content:
I've started a `eip7805-support` branch for dora. Docker image is `ethpandaops/dora:eip7805-support`.
The kurtosis package automatically selects that image if nothing is specified via the config and eip7805 is scheduled for activation. 
So make sure to not override it with the master image in the config ðŸ˜‰
